definition: a person who goes to church services regularly
a shirt worn by somebody playing a sports game
a knitted piece of clothing made of wool or cotton for the upper part of the body, with long sleeves and no buttons; a type of sweater
a type of soft fine knitted cloth used for making clothes
a type of light brown cow that produces high-quality milk

the largest of the Channel Islands, off the north-west coast of France. The main town is St Helier. Jersey has its own government and tax system but has strong links with the UK, and is popular with British tourists. Both English and French are spoken on the island. It is known for its fruit and vegetables (particularly tomatoes and new potatoes called Jersey Royals). The item of clothing called a jersey takes its name from a type of knitted material originally made on the island.
(in the US) another name for the state of New Jersey
a piece of clothing for the upper part of the body, made of wool or cotton, with long sleeves
of very good quality

the outer layer of grain which is left when the grain is made into flour
not containing gluten (= a sticky substance found in some grains, especially wheat)

the inner bark of a South-East Asian tree, used in cooking as a spice, especially in sweet foods
a secret way of writing, especially one in which a set of letters or symbols is used to represent others

the first letters of somebody’s name combined in a design and used to mark things

a thick white liquid food, made by adding bacteria to milk, served cold and often with fruit added; an amount of this sold in a small pot
to prevent somebody, especially a member of your family, from receiving your money or property after your death
the power to choose something freely or to make your own decisions
a strong alcoholic drink made from malted grain. It is sometimes drunk with water and/or ice.
a glass of whisky

the loss of other people’s respect and approval because of the bad way somebody has behaved

a division of a number, for example ⅝

the act of not respecting somebody's rights, peace, privacy, etc.

the state of part of the body being blocked with blood or mucus
